” The    former politician’s downfall came not from the allegations of sexual abuse themselves, but from his efforts to cover them up: In or about 2010, according to the indictment, Hastert —  a former   teacher and coach —  met with an unnamed individual from Yorkville, Hastert’s hometown.
Hastert served as House speaker from 1999 to 2007, and was a high school teacher and wresting coach in Yorkville, Ill. in the 1960s and ’70s.

Scott Cross said Hastert molested him on a massage table at Yorkville High School in Illinois, where they were student and teacher.
Before entering politics, Hastert taught high school in Illinois and coached a wrestling team between 1965 and 1981.

The suit was filed in Kendall County, Ill. on the edge of Chicago’s suburbs, where Mr Hastert worked as a high school wrestling coach in the 1960s, 1970s and early 1980s, and where at least four members of the wrestling team have said he sexually abused them.

The suit adds to a mounting set of legal problems for Mr Hastert, 74, who is expected to be sentenced on Wednesday in federal court here after pleading guilty to a banking violation tied to the abuse.

Disgraced   Speaker Dennis Hastert was sentenced to 15 months in prison Wednesday  —   after bombshell testimony from the brother of a former prominent GOP lawmaker who said Hastert sexually abused him.
